Eselon Dipangkas, Tjahjo Kumolo: Roadmap Rampung Tahun Ini
04 Nov 2019, 10:41 by Pribadi Wicaksono (Kontributor), Rr. Ariyani Yakti Widyastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menteri Pemberdayaan Aparatur Negara dan Reformasi Birokrasi Tjahjo Kumolo menargetkan roadmap penataan kelembagaan tanpa eselon III dan IV rampung pada tahun ini. Saat ini, kata Tjahjo, pihaknya masih menginventarisir segala hal terkait pemangkasan aparatur sipil negara atau ASN di tiap kementerian seperti yang diinstruksikan Presiden Jokowi sebelumnya.
Tjahjo mengaku akan bersikap hati-hati untuk menjalankan instruksi tersebut. Yang pasti, kata dia, kebijakan pemangkasan eselon III dan IV sebagai upaya perampingan birokrasi itu akan dilaksanakan secara marathon setahun ke depan.
Adapun pemangkasan eselon akan dimulai dari Kementerian yang dipimpin Tjahjo Kumolo, yakni Kemenpan RB. "(Pemangkasan eselon III dan IV) sudah clear di Kementerian PAN dan RB. Yang penting penghasilan mereka (yang dipangkas) tidak berkurang, dan mereka menjadi pejabat fungsional,” ujar Tjahjo di Yogyakarta, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Sedangkan untuk kementerian lainnya, Tjahjo mengaku masih akan menginventarisir apa saja yang menjadi kebutuhan. “Kan ada juga beberapa hal-hal (di kementerian lain) yang nggak bisa (langsung dipangkas)," tuturnya.
Lebih jauh, Tjahjo memastikan satu hal yang digarisbawahi dalam pemangkasan eselon adalah agar para karir pegawai tidak terhambat, dan penghasilannya tidak terpotong. "Tidak harus penghasilannya terpotong, minimal sama atau bisa lebih. Tapi tingkat tanggung jawabnya akan semakin tinggi."
Tjahjo menuturkan, langkah pemangkasan eselon III dan IV sudah menjadi instruksi Presiden Jokowi secara nasional merampingkan birokrasi. Jokowi, ujar Tjahjo, lewat pemangkasan eselon III dan IV itu ingin segera ada peningkatan layanan masyarakat yang lebih optimal.
Pemangkasan itu juga diharapkan berimplikasi pada terciptanya program untuk masyarakat yang kian efektif melalui sistem penganggaran yang lebih baik dan tertata. Dan ketiga mendorong pertumbuhan investasi di daerah. “Birokrasi jangan sampai menghambat investasi. Kadang (ribetnya) birokrasi itu yang menghambat investasi,” ujar Tjahjo.
Jadi, kata Tjahjo, arahan Presiden Jokowi mempercepat reformasi birokrasi ini mempermudah investasi di daerah agar pertumbuhan ekonominya berjalan dengan baik. "Dan birokrasi itu mampu untuk memberikan pelayanan kepada masyarakat optimal."
text:
Trimmed Echelon, Tjahjo Kumolo: Roadmap Completed This Year
04 Nov 2019, 10:41 by Pribadi Wicaksono (Contributor), Rr. Ariyani Yakti Widyastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Minister of State Apparatus Empowerment and Bureaucratic Reform Tjahjo Kumolo is targeting a roadmap for institutional structuring without echelon III and IV to be completed this year. At present, said Tjahjo, his party is still inventorying all matters related to trimming the state civil servants or ASN in each ministry as instructed by President Jokowi before.
Tjahjo claimed to be careful to carry out these instructions. What is certain, he said, is that the policy to reduce echelon III and IV as an effort to reduce bureaucracy will be carried out in a marathon next year.
The echelon pruning will start from the Ministry led by Tjahjo Kumolo, namely Kemenpan RB. "(Trimming echelon III and IV) has been clear in the Ministry of PAN and RB. The important thing is that their income (which is cut) is not reduced, and they become functional officials," said Tjahjo in Yogyakarta, Monday, November 4, 2019.
As for other ministries, Tjahjo claimed he would still inventory whatever was needed. "There are also a number of things (in other ministries) that cannot be (directly cut)," he said.
Furthermore, Tjahjo ensured that one thing underlined in echelon pruning was so that employees' careers would not be hampered, and their income would not be cut off. "It doesn't have to be cut off, at least the same or more. But the level of responsibility will be even higher."
Tjahjo said, the steps to cut echelon III and IV had become President Jokowi's instructions nationally to streamline the bureaucracy. Jokowi, said Tjahjo, through the echelon III and IV pruning, there is an immediate desire to improve community services more optimally.
Pruning is also expected to have implications for the creation of programs for the more effective community through a better and orderly budgeting system. And third, encourage investment growth in the regions. "Bureaucracy must not hamper investment. Sometimes (complicated) bureaucracy is hampering investment, "said Tjahjo.
So, said Tjahjo, President Jokowi's direction of accelerating bureaucratic reform facilitated investment in the region so that economic growth went well. "And the bureaucracy is able to provide optimal service to the community."
